conclusion: The electric field is directed along the negative y-axis and the magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane and pointing inward in the fourth quadrant.
The particle is injected from the origin O with an incident direction at a 45° angle to the y-axis.
The particle reaches point P with coordinates (3L, L) in the electric field and its velocity at point P is V0 directed along the positive x-axis.
The x-component of the initial velocity is Vx = V0 / √2.
The y-component of the initial velocity is Vy = V0 / √2.
The time taken to travel the distance in the x-direction is t_x = 3√2L / V0.
The time taken to travel the distance in the y-direction is t_y = √2L / V0.
The total time taken for the particle to move from point O to point P is (3√2 + √2)L / V0.
